dublin_core.dcvalue: Simultaneous multiple injuries of the thumb ray are rare An unusual case of a simultaneous fracture of proximal and distal phalanges trapezium and scaphoid is reported The patient had an acceptable result six months after injury This type of injury of the thumb ray may be a specific form of injury pattern caused by the mobile phone
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-06T18:02:30Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2006-11-02
Hand surgery : an international journal devoted to hand and upper limb surgery and related research : journal of the Asia-Pacific Federation of Societies for Surgery of the Hand
Simultaneous fractures of distal and proximal phalanges of the thumb, trapezium and carpal scaphoid of the ipsilateral hand: a case of very unusual combination of fractures.
